intro: Bupleurum falcatum f. ensifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thornapple, is a variant of the common thornapple species. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. The plant features elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are typically narrower than those of the typical form. Its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and clustered in umbels, which are characteristic of the Apiaceae family. This form is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
